alert.note: Alert for Hidalgo (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 20 at 4:26PM MDT until July 20 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a * Dust Advisory for... West central Hidalgo County in southwestern New Mexico... * Until 515 PM MDT. * At 424 PM MDT, an area of blowing dust was over Road Forks. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong winds up to 40 mph. SOURCE...NMDOT road cameras. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 5 and 19. Locations impacted include... Road Forks, Lordsburg Playa and Pyramid Mountains. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
